item.description:
Hi all,
Please note, this movie screens at 4:25. The film deals with difficult subject matter. I hope many group members agree- some of the better discussions have been provided by movies that aren't neccessarily a good-time. The "good-time" is our discussion afterward.

This is England
Nominated for Best Director and Screenplay at the 2006 British Independent Film Awards Shane Meadows ("Dead Man's Shoes") wrote and directed this semi-autobiographical drama about a fatherless 12-year-old boy whose salty attitude endears him to Woody (Joseph Gilgun), the leader of a relatively benign group of skinheads in an early 1980s British seaside town.

For a while, young Shaun (Thomas Turgoose) is having the time of his life, but when racist ex-con Combo (Stephen Graham) shows up and draws Sean into far more dangerous gambits than vandalizing abandoned buildings, the kid is going to grow up faster than he could have imagined. NY Daily News

Here's a link to one of the many postive reviews: http://www.premiere.c...

As is the custom, Tom will be holding a Meet-Up sign near the front row and then its off to a local restaurant to discuss. I'll probably be refraining from ordering Fish n Chips after this one.

Tom
item.name: This is England- A Skinhead's Tale
